Functions to download EIDITH tables via API

Source: R/api_calls.R
ed_get.Rd

These functions download data directly from the EIDITH API. They require authorization. They can be useful for comparing local data against data updated in the database, or processed vs. unprocessed data. The table functions load data from the local database instead, and are thus faster and work without an internet connection.

ed_get(endpoint, verbose = interactive(), postprocess = TRUE,
  header_only = FALSE, lmdate_from = "2000-01-01",
  lmdate_to = Sys.Date() + 1, auth = NULL, ...)

ed_get_events(verbose = interactive(), postprocess = TRUE,
  header_only = FALSE, lmdate_from = "2000-01-01",
  lmdate_to = Sys.Date() + 1, ...)

ed_get_animals(verbose = interactive(), postprocess = TRUE,
  header_only = FALSE, lmdate_from = "2000-01-01",
  lmdate_to = Sys.Date() + 1, ...)

ed_get_specimens(verbose = interactive(), postprocess = TRUE,
  header_only = FALSE, lmdate_from = "2000-01-01",
  lmdate_to = Sys.Date() + 1, ...)

ed_get_tests(verbose = interactive(), postprocess = TRUE,
  header_only = FALSE, lmdate_from = "2000-01-01",
  lmdate_to = Sys.Date() + 1, ...)

ed_get_viruses(verbose = interactive(), postprocess = TRUE,
  header_only = FALSE, lmdate_from = "2000-01-01",
  lmdate_to = Sys.Date() + 1, ...)

ed_get_testspecimen(verbose = interactive(), postprocess = TRUE,
  header_only = FALSE, lmdate_from = "2000-01-01",
  lmdate_to = Sys.Date() + 1, ...)

Arguments

verbose

Show a progress bar and other messages?
postprocess

Should data be cleaned via ed_process() or returned raw?
header_only

Return only the table header. Useful for checking if API access works
lmdate_from

filter records by earliest date, in YYYY-MM-DD format
lmdate_to

filter records by latest date, in YYYY-MM-DD format (see details)
...

additional arguments passed to httr::GET()

Value

a tibble-style data frame

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
